section.name: Cayenne News
section.p:
Cayenne 1.0 Release Candidate is available for download. Cayenne team is well on track to make a final release later this fall. Download RC1 from here.
Changes in this release:
New website and documentation design, including contextual table of contents in all Guides.
Initial DB2 support.
Fixed a number of bugs related to refreshing and refetching objects.
Fixed nasty bug in the Modeler that would delete entities when a user deletes entity attributes. For Beta 4 users CayenneModeler upgrade is required.
Note on deprecated API: The next release will most likely clean up all the deprecated method and classes. Please update your code now.

u.strong: National Hockey League Switches to Cayenne.

section.p: After the initial trial of Cayenne last October, NHL switched all their public applications running at NHL.com to use Cayenne. With the help from ObjectStyle and Central Park Software the site was successfully launched to production. Currently applications receive more than 5 million hits a day.

section.name: About Cayenne
section.p: Cayenne is a powerful, full-featured OpenSource Object/Relational framework. Cayenne is written in Java and is intended for Java developers working with relational databases. Cayenne has been successfully deployed in production environment on high volume sites. Cayenne has a growing international user and developer community.

Cayenne provides management of persistent Java objects mapped to relational databases, single method call queries and updates (including atomic updates of all modified objects), seamless integration of multiple databases into a single virtual data source. Cayenne is distributed with CayenneModeler - a complete GUI mapping tool that supports reverse-engineering of RDBMS schema, working with database mappings and generation of Java source code for the persistent objects.

Cayenne is an OpenSource project and as such encourages the community to participate in development, testing and writing documentation. This way we can produce a better product that will benefit both contributors and user community.
